intro: Palicourea canarina, commonly known as Canary pellitory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
